p: Flavonoids—The flavonoid assay was performed according to the method detailed by Woisky and Salatino [ 74]. In total, 500 μL of each extract to be analyzed was mixed in duplicate with 1500 μL of methanol at 95%, 100 μL of AlCl 3 at 10% ( m/ v), 100 μL of 1 M sodium acetate and 2.8 mL of distilled water. The whole mixture was vortexed and then incubated at room temperature in a dark condition for 30 min. The blank was made by replacing the extract with methanol at 95%, and the absorbance was measured at 415 nm by a UV-1700 Pharma spectrophotometer (Shimadzu). The results were expressed in mg equivalents of quercetin-3-rutinoside/100 g of dry matter with reference to the calibration curve of quercetin-3-rutinoside. All samples were analyzed in duplicate ( n = 12). The selection of these methods allowed for comparison with other investigations, since they are the most common methods used to quantify these compounds with a good specificity and without additional equipment requirements.
